entry.title: What to do in Brussels this weekend: 10 - 12 May
entry.content:

entry.title: Hidden Belgium: La Roche hiking trails
entry.content:
Hidden Belgium: La Roche hiking trails

The fortress town on a bend in the river deep in the Ardennes offers a fantastic range of 10 clearly-marked hiking trails ranging from a 3km family stroll to a 13km forest ramble.

entry.title: Brussels rapper Damso most-streamed artist in Belgium for fifth time
entry.content:
Brussels rapper Damso most-streamed artist in Belgium for fifth time

"The fact that I am Belgium's most-listened-to artist for the fifth time while I have not released a new album motivates me for the album I am working on now."

entry.title: More than 27,000 visitors at Les Nuits Botanique
entry.content:
More than 27,000 visitors at Les Nuits Botanique

The 2024 edition of the Brussels festival attracted more than 27,000 visitors, and its very first autumn version has already been confirmed for later this year.

entry.title: Where the waste goes: An insight into Brussels' unknown underworld
entry.content:
Where the waste goes: An insight into Brussels' unknown underworld

The average Belgian goes to the toilet six to eight times a day. But how often do we think about where our waste goes after we flush?

entry.content:
Belgian violinist among 70 candidates for Queen Elisabeth Competition

entry.content:

entry.title: Belgium in Brief: Losing faith in society? Look to the Greeks
entry.content:
Belgium in Brief: Losing faith in society? Look to the Greeks

entry.content:
How Ghent is being transformed into Ancient Greece
